content: I show you my stuff with DM Scotty hey fellow DM DM Scotty here good to have
you with me this is the first in a series of videos I'm going to do to
showing things that I've crafted from my own table I have done some things in the
past and my DMS craft and shown some pieces that I've done and talked about
the scenarios but now I'm going to kind of do just just a sideshow that just
shows some things that I've done and I'll explain if it's stuff I haven't
showed before I'll explain how I made the stuff and talk about maybe a little
bit about the scenario or the tile or something that like that but I wanted to
do a show where I could just kind of showcase stuff cuz I have stuff middle
up and I just can't show there's just enough time of the day to show
everything that I craft and I thought it might be kind of cool to did you can see
different tiles and things that I've done different configurations and
different ways I've done it so you know just to spark ideas on you apart so what
I'm going to do is I'm going to start this video series this will be the only
introduction to the video series from here on out I will just go right from
the intro into whatever I'm just going to show you for that day so I just want
to explain what I was doing and what this very video series is going to be so
without further ado let's go to the table and we'll talk about our first
setup here's a fun little tile I'm working on and I it's from the keep on
the shadow palettes with my newer group that I'm running and this is kind of my
interpretation there was a room where where they were digging and so there
were some raised areas and lowered areas now there's submit the interesting stuff
on this tile I have some double raised platforms
double cardboard for the platform it's still deeper to fall in the pit than it
looked in it you know that it actually looks but it gives it it does give it a
sense of height so that there's some height to it and then you know it's more
like ten feet to the to the bottom of hit I also have a cave an exit that
leads to a natural cave out of this room so I got that on there I did that with
the technique of just doing the edging with the glue gun and so I didn't cut
any part of the tile out I also there's some collapsed area in this room so I
had this kind of coming in where this area collapsed now a couple cool
features I have also on here are these bridges and these bridges were just
super easy to make they're just thin cardboard and I wanted to be kind of
rickety looking so I you know did them a little irregularly I also used a thin
piece of cardstock as like a brace on the bridge now give you a little look
there basically all I did with these bridges was I base painted in black then
I painted them dark brown the burnt umber and then I used a lighter spiced
Brown to do draw the planks on with the brush and then I just outlined them with
some black paint to give it a little more definition and there you go I also
did a little bit of black texture on there with the sponge to give it a
little bit of variation so that that was quick and easy so these were super quick
and easy you can cut these to any length you need
you can see I have varying sizes on here this one here is actually leading down
into the pit so that one kind of I have that leaning up and then these span
these areas these raised areas now you may have also noticed that I have a
ladder and these are kind of an interesting little concept here let me
show you this now you can see it's not the length that a real ladder would be
but it's kind of simulating a ladder so they did is I just took a piece of
heavy cardstock and bent it and I put a little bit of glue in the in the crevice
there to keep it from unbending then I took some matchsticks and did the edges
of the ladder and then took some toothpicks and did the rungs of the
ladder so I only put four rungs in there and but I use the match matchsticks to
line the edge and the way that this is set up with the angle there it'll lean
up against it look in so it'll look like it's leaning up against that area
without me actually having to lay it over the area and then it possibly
falling off this way it's very sturdy it won't fall off and it's hidden anyway
you can't really see it so that those look great and I've got a few of those
I've got one there and I've got one there so those are that's a great little
trick to make ladders that you know are not the actual height ladder would be
but give the impression that it's a ladder coming up so there you go this is
a really nice tile here's the entrance to the tile so if the players came in
they would come through here and then they can go down into the pit or they
could go across and then you know they get across and fight these guys and that
kind of thing so have a fun little battle on these platforms so there we go
there's some nice tile with some quick and easy techniques for making ladders
and bridges so I'll talk to you later take care hey crafters I hope you've
enjoyed this episode of the DMS craft make sure to subscribe and I have tons
of other videos as you can see I am the originator of the 2.5 D method of
crafting tiles I also do dirt cheap terrain for the table if all this
intrigues you make sure you check out all the videos below also join my forum
we have lots of great crafters on there who
advice I have a link above and below and last but not least remember go forth and
craft you
